meanings.definition: Make someone liable or inclined to a specified attitude, action, or condition before it occurs.
meanings.sent1: Eating unhealthy food can predispose you to weight gain.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise can predispose individuals to a positive mindset.
meanings.sent3: His love for adventure predisposed him to seek new challenges.
meanings.sent4: Her optimistic nature predisposed her to see the bright side of every situation.
meanings.sent5: The calming music predisposed her to relax and unwind after a long day.

meanings.definition: Make someone more likely to have a particular disease or condition.
meanings.sent1: Smoking can predispose individuals to respiratory problems.
meanings.sent2: Genetic factors can predispose some people to certain health issues.
meanings.sent3: His habit of skipping meals predisposed him to feeling weak and tired.
meanings.sent4: Living in a polluted area can predispose residents to respiratory illnesses.
meanings.sent5: Lack of sleep can predispose individuals to a weakened immune system.
